titleInfo.title: LSU History Oral History Project: Faculty & Adminstrators
titleInfo.subTitle: Maurice Morrissette oral history interview, 1993

name.description: Maurice Morrissette was professor and head of the Department of Veterinary Physiology, Pharmacology, and Toxicology at the LSU School of Veterinary Medicine from 1969 to 1982 and assistant to the dean of the School of Veterinary Medicine for facility planning and control from 1982 to 1987.

subject.topic: Louisiana State University (Baton Rouge, La.).--School of Veterinary Medicine.

mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries Special Collections (http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special)
mods.accessCondition: Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright is retained by Louisiana State University in accordance with U.S. copyright laws.

"E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments. See instructions for ordering reprints of this audio here: http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special/services/duplication.html Mention the ""Item number"" or ""Item URL"" in your request. "
mods.abstract: Morrissette discusses his family, his service in the Coast Guard during World War II, his role in establishing the School of Veterinary Medicine, and his duties as chairman of the school's building committee.
